--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "David Goudreau" <dgoudreau@q...> 
wrote:
> I'm creating a framework to test XML responses to our system.  
Right now I
> have a properties file that contains 1) every file request I want 
to send to
> our system and 2) the xpath expressions I want to run on the XML 
response,
> to make sure it's correct.  The properties file looks like this:
> 
> The problem I'm having is that I want each <file> to run as a 
separate test
> in the JUnit framework.  Right now, even if I have 100 files that 
I want to
> test in my properties file, the JUnit framework treats it all as 
one test.
> I don't want test #4 to fail and then prevent the other 96 tests 
from
> running, which is what's happening now.  Any ideas?  Thanks.

You could define a static Test suite() method that went through the 
file and created a TestSuite containing one of your test cases for 
each request/response pair. I can think of more complicated 
solutions, but that's where I'd start.

Kent
